caption: I went here yesterday for my birthday. The restaurant was having major technical issues.  My reservation was for 7:15pm - which they couldn’t even find. I didn’t get my food until around 9:00pm. As a member of the restaurant industry, if my customers waited 2 hours for their food I would have at LEAST made the bill half off, or offered free dessert, or SOMETHING. Anything! The restaurant is quite dysfunctional and unorganized. I regret choosing this restaurant for my birthday. I will never come here again.
I had an amazing experience the food was very good and services also got
The look of the reataurant is basic BUT THE FOOD IS SOOOO GOOD!!
man, zero words
Love this place it's definitely have that New Orleans vibe food is excellent and the servers and cook is on point i would recommend
It was great, just the service was SLOW.
The food & drinks were great but the waitress was horrible and rude  🤦🏽‍♀️ I Definitely will return I’ll just be picky with my waitress.
The food is creative in the sense that the food combinations are unexpected but delicious.  For example,  Creole Seafood fried rice!! My family enjoyed the shrimp and grits😋

Great Black owned business. The only negative, too many young people. The level of professionalism in a business atmosphere was a bit lacking. Food was amazing and drinks are definitely STRONG. I implore you to share the experience and support.

NOT A CHILD FRIENDLY MUSIC place. They played music that was not censored!!! I mean it wouldn't even be played on the radio. We did ask them to change the songs and they did "for about 15 min". The server was nice. We went midday and it was 2 others, so that was good bc of Covid. The Bayou Rolls were delish BUT THE CRAB CAKES WERE NOT. They were oily and tasted like noodle flour. I guess it was their spin but somethings you just need to leave seafood alone!!!  All our other food was very good (blackened catfish, not overly seasoning) and chicken tenders. All food servings were ok. I would go again without the kids and just wear my headphones to listen to my own music or sit at the fenced in outside tables on a nice day!

Pay close attention to your receipt. I came in with just my best friend and later found that the waitress charged a gratuity fee for a party of 6!!! It was only 2 of us. Beware! Also the food was over salted nowhere near as good as authentic New Orleans food. 2 stars because the music and mimosas was good.
Video of review was posted
Food was good .. atmosphere was nice ...just a little over price .
EVERYTHING WAS AWESOME!!! FOOD, STAFF, ENVIRONMENT...AWESOME!!!

Took forever to get a server and food took about an hour.  Appetizer came the same time as the meal and it was put in 30 minutes before.  The server was friendly but blamed everything on them being under staffed.  Got 15%off and free drinks but I just hope they get it together because there is so much potential.  Drinks were not good at all

I really love this place!!  I've been visiting since shortly after they opened, and the food is consistently AMAZING.  The happy hour is one of the best in the city at the moment - including a number of menu options and cocktails.  The entrees are 🔥🔥 too.  The service has been getting better and better as the management feels out the neighborhood and grapples with covid.  I'll be happy to go back and to bring people with me.

Food and service was great. You can only order off certain menus during specific times of the day but everything was amazing. I only gave 4 stars b/c the bathroom was utterly disgusting it was like a nightclub bathroom urine everywhere and it was only 2pm!!! so if u can hold it do but the food is delicious

I made a reservation here and about 5 minutes after I made that reservation, I called to ask if it was ok if I pushed it back by 15 minutes. The person on the phone said that was just fine. My friends and I got to the restaurant later that night. We waited for a few minutes and then we spoke to the hostess to get seated. She was very rude to us for absolutely no reason. She said that I had missed my reservation...which I had not, and I explained to her that I didn’t. I guess no one passed along the fact that I had called the restaurant hours earlier to change my reservation. Anyway, another friend came with us and then the hostess said there was no way she could seat us because we had an extra person in the party. I totally understood that and my friends and I walked out of there and went to another restaurant. It wasn’t a big deal. The problem was that in speaking to my party, the hostess was extremely rude and snappy with us when we were on very chill energy. Firstly, I didn’t miss my reservation...so no reason to be rude about it. Secondly, if you couldn’t seat us because of the extra person that’s totally fine...but there’s a way to speak with customers in a respectful manner. It was unfortunate b/c my friends and I were looking forward to eating there and would’ve tried to make a reservation for another day. But I don’t even want to eat at a restaurant where I’m subject to unnecessarily rude behavior.
The Rockefeller oyster were fantastic... the wine selection was pretty bad and the white wines were not kept at proper temperature

I dined here before and the food was great and so was the atmosphere.  We had an entree meal and bottomless mimosas, adn they had music playing while you sat and ate your food.  I will dine there againw when in town.

Don’t go.. yallll. The food is horrible. The drinks are decent. Customer service is bad. Floors were extremely wet and slippery I literally had to tip toe to the restroom. I went to try it our despite the reviews to support a blck business but it was truly BAD. The food was either too salty or no seasoning. Our waiter was upset that we called the manager over to send our food back . The manager was nice didnt argue with us but had to tell our waiter to calm down. Also our waiter would literally would NOT keep his mask on . It was a very insane experience and would not recommend. :(

Friendly staff. Social distancing in place and staff wore their mask. Food was delicious. The salmon and crab over grits was 👌🏾. The jambalaya over  rice was good. The waitress said it is spicy so I asked for a little spice. It was tasty but still spicy! The shrimp were Buffalo style and a hint of sweetness and yummy. The bread pudding was too mushy for me.

1st there, used to live in the area, many years ago. Restaurant is new great atmosphere, and the food is excellent.  Kudos to the chef! Love the open space in the rear. I  will retun, when I am back in town.
The food was delicious! I had the oxtails and they slapped! Drinks were on point too as well as the service. Our server/bartender was on it...drinks flowed consistently. I'll definitely be back.
My Go to spot
The place to eat and relax,great service

OMG....this was our 1st time here and everything was great. The food, the drinks, the music, and the service. They have great menu options. A little something for everyone. Their portion sizes were right on the money. I couldn't be happier about our experience at Creole on the 14th. We will be back...very soon!
Loved this place. Its something different and the food is good. Moderately priced.
Great service,  food and drinks! Really good music!
Terrific food especially the lobster mac & cheese and the deviled eggs! Clean restrooms and great service!
The service was amazing and the food was delicious. We drove around to find a park and it was well worth it. Black owned business that delivered exceptional service. 5 stars all day.

Absolutely delicious. From the hostess to our waitress Cam (like Newton), to the food! Definitely will be back. Had the lobster fettuccine, chicken wings, fries, bayou chicken rolls, and the black chicken pasta. 🔥🔥🔥
The food was great. When i return to DC i will definitely patronage there again.

The food was great! I especially enjoyed the crab spinach dip and the loaded pasta! Someone in my party got the shrimp & grits which she really liked but felt like they could've given a little more grits. And last but certainly not last the drinks were amazing as well! Very personable staff also!

Went to "Taco Tuesday". Although I think the chef has great food ideas, the execution/flavor isn't there. For instance, the fish tacos, they don't use tilapia(impressive), it was fried snapper; the tacos were very fishy in taste. The honey lime shrimp tacos were interesting. There was no honey or lime flavor; just heavy on guacamole. The food and drinks are costly. I did not feel like it was worth my money.

The food, service and energy was amazing. The prices were very good too. My friends and I dug into our plates and forgot to take pics. I had the oxtail meal and had to take them home so I could really dig in! Lol. My friends raved about the jambalaya and the shrimp and grits. I would definitely recommend Creole on 14th and be back soon.
Food was alright. It was nothing special - service was alright. The pace is a good for a brunch where the drinks are heavy if you get my drift.
Great food and great vibe
Absolutely amazing!!! Food and drinks are awesome.

Was there this weekend and everything from the staff,mimosas and food was great!! The other reviews I wouldn’t worry about the restaurant to my knowledge is new so give it a chance it’s on the rise..Our waitress was Steph!!! She checked on us often and made sure we never seen an empty glass of our bottomless mimosas ! The music was lit R&b & Hip hop so it was a vibe.... we were dancing with the staff and had the whole restaurant lit up! and overall had a really great time. Super friendly. Food was tasty... get the shrimp & grits! I didn’t make reservations but I would recommend you do! Thanks again to our waitress Steph! - Shacole & Tori
This is new little spot with a great atmosphere  and better food. However, the wait, 30 minutes with a reservation  was a bit much.

Honest review. I was skeptical initially.  Pros: The food was VERY good and I am a tough critic . My partner and I ordered the egg rolls , wings , shrimp and grits and rib eye ( side of mashed potatoes and asparagus). Yum yum yum! Typical DC prices.  Service was great! I loved my server Kenisha. Everyone was very personable and accommodating.  Cons: The ambiance and decor need a major revamp. Dive Bar floors - yet a day party feel in the middle . Not great lighting in general. For the price, I was expecting a more polished decor.  The bathroom was not well maintained and the lock was broke. Received an unwelcome guest which was upsetting as I did not know the lock did not actually work.  Music is really explicit and could potentially offend guest . I mean , I was down to turn up but know your audience. The edited versions will suffice.  However , the cons were not enough to discourage me from returning . I’ll be back to support black business and eat good again!!! Try it for yourself like we did. We were not disappointed!
Great food! Good drinks. Will return, wanting to try more on menu.
Sunday October 4,2020 my first time there the food was great,the atmosphere was lively,friendly vibe. Looking forward to going again
Great food, HORRIBLE service. Be prepared and bring your calculator.

The food is not nola style Creole but it is good. All of the drinks are delicious as well. I would only go during happy hour because drinks and apps are half off. Otherwise the price isnt worth it. The service is a little slow but I think most of the people are new to the service industry.

I visited the restaurant last week with a friend. The drinks were just okay and were missing some of the elements listed on the menu. The spinach dip was very soupy, the salmon was a bit bland, as was the mac and cheese.
I went during happy hour the drinks were excellent the service was wonderful and the food was out of this world I love them

The hostess was very nice. But the food was extremely BLAND! I order the crab fries, which were mediocre & the “jambalaya” chicken tacos. As a Louisiana native, I must say there was NOTHING about those tacos that even related to jambalaya! & the chicken was tasteless. I told my server the tacos weren’t good & she offered 50% off of the tacos which was fair because I ate one. She went to the back to tell her boss, when she returned she literally  told me her boss didn’t want to refund or take anything off but would replace the meal with another, I agreed to that by getting shrimp tacos. I was still charged full price for the shrimp tacos instead of the price for the chicken tacos.

Great food! Great drinks!! The system crashed and it took 2 hours to get our check. So that’s the reason I put 4 stars. But the food was amazing, the atmosphere is great and fun! My friends and I enjoyed our brunch.
Kanisha is amazing! Ask for her!
Food is amazing. Staff was friendly, responsive, and fun. Excellent location. Try the grits!

The brunch was amazing! The food was delicious and the staff was amazing. My lamb chop was cooked perfectly, and I loved the bottomless blood orange mimosas. I can't wait to come back and try out the dinner or happy hour here!
Nice place
Everything here taste amazing! I was impressed
I love the restaurant that's going to be my 2nd home at least 3 days out the week food is great wages agree the bartender was great to cook is great
Nice place for dinner and drinks.

I feel like 2 stars is being generous. However, our waiter was extremely nice.  I am convinced every person who gave 5 stars is friends with the owners. Because there is NO WAY anyone with taste buds would give 5 stars.  My party of 4 arrived at 4:30pm and the brunch crowd was just starting to clear out. Every table seemed to be having a good time! However, for us, not so much. One person ordered the snapper, which had a pretty presentation, unfortunately, it lacked flavor. The Mac and cheese tasted like nothing (literally had to add salt/pepper/ and hot sauce for it to be eatable) & the dirty rice was nothing spectacular. The corn bread tasted more like cake but it was good.  the jambalaya? Ha, don’t even waste your time or calories!! Another friend of mine ordered the steak MEDIUM well. However, when she got it, it was so over cooked she couldn’t even cut into it.  I got the lamb chops (very small portion) with mashed potatoes and the “veggies of day” which was really just corn mixed with a few pieces of onions, broccoli and mushrooms. My lamb wasn’t half bad and the mashed potatoes was probably the most seasoned thing on our table. However. After taxes, I paid 52$ for my meal (not including drinks) so I would not say it was worth it  As a young professional, I do not mind paying top notch for my food. Like others have said, this place is expensive yet lacks the quality and portions are extremely small. I would suggest they hire a new chef.  The decor is pretty and the people from brunch seemed to have had a great time. Because this is black owned I MAY come back for brunch and just get drinks. Again, the only reason I gave them 2 stars was solely because the waiter was extremely nice.

I didnt enjoy my experience with Creole.  Food isnt bad, but presentation was a miss.  Staff didnt know what was good on the menu.  some replied that they didnt know.  Rule number 1: Chef has to give tastings of everything on the menu to staff.  New patrons do ask for recommendations.  Being told "I dont know" is a huge turnoff.  Cant say I wont go again, but it will be some time before I dare go back.

Only been for happy hour on Saturday and was extremely satisfied. Probably because I was full of the bottomless mimosas, but wings, fried tomatoes, seafood omelette and grits were on point. The omelette was more of a egg covered in seafood, but good nonetheless.
Food was delicious.  Will definitely be coming back!

My sister and I found out about this black owned establishment via Facebook and decided to support. We were seated right away. Waiter took our drink order. I ordered the Voodoo Storm which i don't recommend and my sister had Miss Nola. First off the glass had red lipstick on the brim from a previous user because she had no lipstick on. We ordered fried green tomatoes and had to ask for small plates and napkins. Waiter brought us out dirty plates and napkins we asked for another set by the time that came our starter was cold. We spoke to someone who states he was the supervisor or assistant manager not to sure of his title. He apologized to us and made us some fresh tomatoes and brought our new drinks in to go cups. So moving forward we order our food. The lamb and plantains were awesome. Mac n cheese was to garlicky and onionly so he took that off for us. When we got the bill we were charged for drinks that were supposed to be taken off so we had to wait another 20 mins for that. Then they ran receipt paper and we had to take a pic on our phone. We sat down at 737pm and did not leave until 10pm. The service was extremely slow. Management did not take care of us and we spent 160.00. On top of that we travelled from Timonium/Lutherville area just to be disappointed. Our girls night out was ruined. I can see the potential in this place but the service is horrible and something needs to be done.
Drinks were good, service was excellent!!!  Can't wait to go back!
Very good food. Nice DC brunch vibes.
The food is amazing! We thoroughly enjoyed our meal.

I was very excited to visit this restaurant. Black owned and creole? I couldn't believe it my 2 favorite things. However, I was left very unsatisfied and didn't even get the chance to taste all of the food or drink options I set out to try. We were greeted and seated right away but as far as our drinks and food (appetizers), they took longer than expected. It took 40 minutes for drinks and then our food came another 40 minutes after. The spinach dip is more of a sautéed spinach bowl but the pita chips that accompanied them were delicious. The crab fries were okay. I would recommend making the fries thicker and adding a bit more seasoning and crab meat. The crab claws (took the longest at 1hour and 15 minutes) to arrive at the table. They were very small and I was underwhelmed at the presentation. In terms of the crab mac and cheese, yes there was an overwhelming amount of cheese but it lacked seasoning. I had plans to order an entree as well as a dessert but due to the long wait times I changed my mind. Lastly, the staff may need additional training, we were told that the crab claws were on the happy hour menu but it turned out they weren't and despite the horrid experience, they were not discounted. Sadly I do not think I nor my friends will be returning.

8pm, Friday night, told the bar had run out of the proper drink glasses. Ordered the lamb shops, they were overcooked. Plaintains dry, cornbread crumbled. Spinich dip/crab was soupie The waitress Brianna was the only bright spot of the whole experience. Was so looking forward to the experience. bartendant and chef on Friday night was a disappointment.

1st time here on 08.09.2020 . Ate out on the patio. Although we were late for our brunch reservation they still accomated us. I ordered the ($20) crab cake Benedict with a fried egg instead of poached because I just dont do runny eggs. Everything was good. I didnt have any shells in the crab cake. The biscuit was good. & the hashbrowns/home fries were good also. Everything was nicely seasoned. I wouldn't mind going back, plus we lucked up & found a great parking space right up front. Menu is on a QR code. Bottomless regular mimosas was $25.
The food is everything it should be and then some! This place is a must if you’re in the area.

This place was a disgrace. I ordered an appetizer that never came, I ordered steak and they didn't have any steak sauce, never given a knife and was cutting my steak with a butter knife, they ran out of ice and we didn't get our drinks until 40 minutes of us being there. The other parties of my table had to wait for their food(Our food did not come out together) and they still have me a check for $120.00. The nerve of this black owned business. Horrible experience and I will not be going back!!!

This is not a traditional new Orleans style restaurant. They food was terrible and portion size was extremely small for the expensive price. The rest rooms were in terrible condition especially considering Covid. No paper towels and toilet tissue used to dry hands. Overall My family and I was totally unsatisfied and unimpressed. The waiter was excellent!!
The food tasted fine, but portions were extremely small for the prices they charged. And skip the Creole cornbread. It is $6 for a tiny 2"x2" piece

I paid $23.00 for the oxtail dinner but they only give you three oxtails. The Mac & cheese is nasty but the dirty rice was good just not enough. The restaurant is too expensive and you only get a little bit of food.
From the cocktails to the service to the food...juts exceptionally dope!

Wonderful restaurant! Food is amazing, servers incredibly nice and the dj plays really good music during brunch. I had a small problem with my creditcard and the manager was very helpful and kind. Definitely recommend it! Happy vibes!
Great food. Service is good too
I just will never go back a real disappontment.
Love the atmosphere. Didn’t get to try the food but my drink was great. I came during the soft opening and it was a nice crowd

Tasting and filling food. Great service. Definitely going back. I hope they expand their business. The front area is kind of small. But the food is definitely a must try. We'll be going back once the rona is over. We enjoyed ourselves.

Ordered for delivery and food was pretty bland. I wouldn’t recommend it to any one that has ever been to New Orleans. Maybe there is more flavor when you eat at the restaurant, instead of ordering out.
Great portions. Seems as if menu should be rounded out. Will def check out again this fall as food style a lil too heavy for me during summer. Excellent locale. Drinks WHOO! Sip slow.

The hit of the week is Creole on 14th Street🔥. This new black owned spot is a true hit from start to finish. The staff is very friendly and polite. The menu lures you in with all of the different options that appeal to your taste buds. You can't help but feeling like it is a must to order everything. We noticed many tables around us kept ordering several items on the menu which confirmed their sharing of the same feelings about the menu. We even thought one table with only two people ordered all but two things on the menu 🤣.  We settled on crab claws as a starter which were flavored perfectly and our first crab claws dish. For your entre you won't be disappointed with the ribeye or the shrimp creole. When it was all said and done both of our plates were clear and totally cleaned. The food is perfectly seasoned and although it says creole the dishes aren't overly spicy, which is perfect for me the non spicy girl. End your meal with the bread pudding. Although the scoop of ice cream could be a tad bigger the hot bread pudding  with whisky caramel and vanilla ice cream is a perfect combination and way to end the evening. Everything was absolutely delicious 😋 💯❤. We will be back soon for sure, of course we have to try something new on the menu #blackownedbusiness #fallynsfoodieexcursions #fallynsfoodieexcursionscovid19edition
The food was very delicious!!! I’m so happy to have some new flavor on 14th st

Nice environment and music. Service was okay (another party who arrived after us, was greeted before us). The blackened chicken pasta and oxtails were great, however the Mac n cheese looked like it was from the box. Overall, I would return to support this black owned business.

Food was absolutely delicious. We had the whole snapper with the seafood macaroni and cheese and the Salmon with the seafood fried rice. Oh and the spinach dip with crab and garlic chips. Amazing!!!!!!!!

Good customer service! They need to work on the decor and music. It's not family friendly. They had no high chairs & no kid menu. The food was ok. I had the Creole bird with Mac & Cheese. I was better off having Safeway $5 chicken. The Mac & Cheese tasted like Bob Evans microwavable mac & cheese. It also had chunks of garlic. Which it thur my taste buds off.I'm going to give it one more try, because I like supporting local businesses.

Reeeaaally delicious food and friendly staff! Their Mac and cheese was perfect. Ordered the hot burger but ended up with the creole bird by mistake and it was so good - not even worth complaining about. Was seasoned great and very tender. New place working out the kinks but will definitely be back!
We got the seafood mac and shrimp and grits to go, and it was absolutely delicious! We didn't have to wait too long for the food and the host was lovely :)
Fantastic food. Seafood dishes are a tad bit pricey but still great. Get the crab cakes

Creole on 14th exceeded all my expectations and I will absolutely be a regular here , despite it being 45 minutes away from my home. Although it was busy, the staff was friendly, knowledgeable and attentive. Also, the vibe was  perfect!  Don't even get me started on the food. EVERYTHING I tried was good. Everything . The food is perfectly seasoned, and not  over salted. The proportions are great, and the signature cocktails are a perfect compliment.  Really sad I didn't have enough space to try the creole bread pudding with vanilla whiskey!

Visited a few days ago with college friends and ran into sorority sisters. Though packed, we were all able to receive tables in a timely manner. While waiting, the staff were attentive, patient, accommodating.  Also, the vibe was relaxed for a busy night and one of the first after the city reopened more businesses due to COVID-19.  The food was flavorful and well seasoned and the portions are very ample. I truly enjoyed the fried green tomatoes and blackened cajun chicken linguine. Thought I’d have room for the brownie but will order it during my next visit.  Think this will become a welcome go-to spot for this area of the city.

I dined at the restaurant on Friday night. The atmosphere and food were fantastic. The staff were friendly and I was seated rather quickly considering we were late for our reservation. The seafood Mac and cheese, grilled wings and dirty rice were all delicious. I appreciated seeing the staff wipe the tables and chairs with disinfectant wipes between each customer.  I especially enjoyed the music played by DJ Lo Hefe. We will definitely be going back again and again. #shoplocal #SupportBlackBusinesses

The food was fantastic. I could eat the Dirty Rice everyday. The grilled wing were nice. I really liked the unique dipping sauces. It is not on the menu, but YOU MUST HAVE THE HURRICANE.   Lastly, I really appreciate the way the staff wiped down both the tables and chairs with Clorox wipes.  This will definitely be my new neighbor spot.

I heard great things about the food so I had to check it out, for a fairly new restaurant you all are handling the crowd pretty well. People were spread apart in the dining room which I appreciate, especially due to covid- 19 concerns. Staff were all wearing masks which I also appreciated!

Wow! the Seafood Soup was amazingggg!!! I am the kind  of person that will eat soup in hot weather and your soup surpassed expectations. It came out hot and ready. The wait time was average eventhough it was pretty busy,  I was seated promptly even without a reservation. I do recommend you guys get a reservation though. Ill be back!! :)

For a new restaurant you guys surpassed my expectations, it was pretty busy when I came in and I was seated right away. All of the staff was wearing masks which I loved. I loved the dirty rice and Bubbles on Bourbon street. I dont have any complaints, Ill be back with my girls :)

This review was written as a takeout order on June 26th, 2020.  TLDR; Great food at a moderate to expensive price point. I don't feel comfortable coming back though until I see that they've stepped up their COVID-19 safeguards and when the team there has worked out their operational kinks.  COVID-19 Precautions: Outdoor and Indoor seating were extremely dense. I doubt all of the tables were 6 -feet apart. I also saw patrons sitting at the bar when there were bartenders working. They allowed people waiting for tables to queue up indoors as well with no social distancing. Most of the staff were wearing masks which was good. For a new local restaurant opening up in the worst impacted neighborhood in DC, I expected a bit more in this area.  Food: The food was delicious, I had the Creole Bird, the chicken was delicious and well cooked, the seasoning on top was delicious. Mashed Potato sides I got was very average though the 'Dirty Rice' side was spot on. The French Fries were delicious as well. Not many gluten free options, but vegetarians should find a few items they can enjoy.  Pricing: So you can expect a price range of $20-$60 per person w/o drinks included. The sandwiches will give you the best value while some of the seafood entrees get pricey, though pretty standard for the area. My recommendation here is to skip the chicken entrees (~$20) as you can find more delicious chicken dishes at the nearby Latinx cuisines for a little bit less.  Experience: It's a brand new restaurant during a soft opening, so there were some kinks to work out. It took us a while to finally pay for our takeout but again, this is to be expected for a new restaurant. Couple things that left me on a sour note though, I paid $2 more to get the chicken stuffed with Spinach and Cheese and that didn't happen. And we were supposed to get a 10% neighborhood welcome discount, that was not applied to our bill, I should've noticed this so I'll chalk this up to being my fault.
Food half cooked and order wrong never order from them again.
